body_html:
I doubt anyone has 2^63 bytes of RAM in their system

With today's actual 64-bit hardware, it is literally impossible to address that much RAM, physics constraints notwithstanding.

zdevito/ATen#171 seems related.

Did we ever write down our int64_t philosophy anywhere? It definitely feels like, when using 64-bit uniformly, the place it hurts the most is when you need to convert into ssize_t, and now compilers will give a warning unless you explicitly convert.

body:
> I doubt anyone has 2^63 bytes of RAM in their system

With today's actual 64-bit hardware, it is literally impossible to address that much RAM, physics constraints notwithstanding.

https://github.com/zdevito/ATen/issues/171 seems related.

Did we ever write down our `int64_t` philosophy anywhere? It definitely feels like, when using 64-bit uniformly, the place it hurts the most is when you need to convert into `ssize_t`, and now compilers will give a warning unless you explicitly convert.
